topic: North Korea nuclear test status Jan 2026
summary: NK ready since 2022 but no signs of imminent test; focused on missile tests and party congress
content:
Key findings:
- Last nuclear test: September 2017 (8+ years ago), 6 total tests since 2006
- Tunnel No. 3 at Punggye-ri ready since mid-2022; US and SK assess all preparations complete
- Nov 2025 satellite imagery: Tunnel No. 3 open but NO vehicles, human activity, or test prep (no instruments, power lines, cables)
- SK DIA warned Nov 5, 2025: NK "could carry out a nuclear test within a short period of time"
- Jan 2026: NK focused on missile tests (hypersonic, cruise missiles, rocket launchers)
- Jan 28, 2026: Kim to unveil plans to boost nuclear forces at upcoming party congress
- Base rate: ~2.7% per month (6 tests over 225 months)
- NK has been "ready" for 3.5+ years without testing - strong revealed preference against testing
- No Polymarket markets; Manifold conditional market suggests low test probability
